thread.title: Immigrant ‘Dreamer’ Case May Be Heard Next Week - WSJ
thread.title_full: Immigrant ‘Dreamer’ Case May Be Heard Next Week - WSJ

author: Alejandro Lazo
title: Immigrant ‘Dreamer’ Case May Be Heard Next Week - WSJ
text:
U.S. Immigrant ‘Dreamer’ Case May Be Heard Next Week The case could be an early test of how the Trump administration will treat recipients of an Obama administration program known as DACA By @AlejandroLazo Updated Feb. 17, 2017 5:55 p.m. ET 
A Mexican immigrant who is a beneficiary of the Obama administration program known as DACA will remain in detention until an immigration judge hears his case as early as next week, a federal judge in Seattle ruled Friday. 
Civil rights attorneys filed suit earlier this week calling 23-year-old Daniel Ramirez Medina’s Feb. 10 arrest unconstitutional. Until the case is heard by an immigration judge, Mr. Ramirez will remain in... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Most Popular Videos
